answers.answer: Hello sir and hope you are doing well.Yes the persisting high ALT levels could be due to fatty liver changes. Fatty liver can be due to alcoholism when it is called Alcoholic fatty liver disease and the other one is Non alcoholic fatty liver disease, which is due to obesity, diabetes and high triglyceride levels. So, have your lipid profile done and try to bring the fatty changes under control. Also, avoid drugs like paracetomol and sedatives. Get vaccinated for hepatitis A and B. Take a good protein diet. I would advise you to wait for now and repeat the test after four weeks to see how the levels are progressing.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: hi , iam male , 25 years old , 95 kg weight , iam a general practitioner doctor . not suffering from any type of illness ,  2 months ago , i did abdominal ultrasound just as routine check up . the doctor told me that i have a mildly fatty liver , he also told me that it's common problem among individuals specially obese like me :) . he didn't gave me any medications at all . 2 weeks ago , i did liver enzyme test and it was (Alt = 69 & AST = 34 ) . I repeated the test in another lab after 3 days and the result was (ALT = 64 & AST = 32 ) . As you see the level of ( ALT ) is higher than normal . I just Want to ask if this high level is due to Fatty liver , or there is another disorder that I have to search for such as viral hepatitis . iam non-diabetic non hypertensive non alcohol intaker nor ciggarette smoker . thanks .
title: Elevated ALT enzyme
